subject: JUnitPerf and JUnit4
msgSnippet: Has someone successfully used JUnitPerf with JUnit4 test classes? If so, please post example(s), either here or on
messageBody:
Has someone successfully used JUnitPerf with JUnit4 test classes?
If so, please post example(s), either here or on

http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/junitperf/messages

Why I ask (and ask here):

I have a test framework developed with JUnit 3.8.x that uses JUnitPerf
TimedTest's. It needed refactoring, and I could see how a cleaner
refactoring could be done without extends TestCase. Unfortunately

* JUnit4's timeout requires a constant expression, and I want (and do)
get the timeout value dynamically.

* I want my tests to be runnable within a third framework (PDE Build)
which I know supports JUnit3 tests, I am told (by someone I trust)
supports JUnit4 tests, and I don't know supports TestNG tests.
<aside>Information about TestNG/PDEBuild-integration appreciated.
</aside>

So I relinked my framework with the JUnit 4.1 JAR and twiddled it
(e.g. annotated, twiddled imports and asserts <aside>anybody got
pointer(s) to JUnit3->JUnit4 migration automation? </aside>) and the
good news was, it ran! but the bad news was, it wouldn't time out ...

I tried a few different things which I unfortunately did not record in
the heat of the moment--definitely JUnit4TestAdapter and @RunWith(
Suite.class)--but could not make the @#$%^&! thing timeout. So I
posted the JUnitPerf list

http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/junitperf/message/86

because it seemed to be the place to ask (am I missing something?)
despite the fact that Mike Clark hasn't posted there in over a year.
The next day, someone else posted a similar question

http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/junitperf/message/87

though asking about LoadTest as well. So if you've got examples of how
to run a LoadTest or TimedTest (especially the latter :-) under
JUnit4, please reply to me, to junit@yahoogroups.com, to
junitperf@yahoogroups.com, or all of the above.
